metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2374 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.25 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.1 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-router - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.26-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
